marklogic.body: It may make us feel all warm and fuzzy to help out smaller, disadvantaged businesses with taxpayer money but the reality is that these businesses are usually less experienced, less efficient and ground zero for waste, abuse and fraud.Â The entire government contracting and procurement process is a mess and this is just one small part of it (contractors are actually penalized for completing projects under-budget and employ people whose sole purpose is to each project meets or exceeds a predetermined cash "Burn-rate").Â Considering the dire financial condition of our country, government agencies need to be more concerned about getting the greatest bang for each taxpayer dollar than hitting some arbitrary, feel-good contract allocation targets.Â Let the good businesses grow and make the bad ones adapt or disappear, and we'll all be better Off in the end.
